title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau lead BC with 39 combined goals in the 2025-26 season.
Letourneau has emerged with 19 goals this season after scoring none as a freshman at Boston College.
The Bruins' young prospects show potential, aiding the team's rejuvenation and playoff aspirations.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An NBA assistant coach considers the Boston Celtics 'the clear pick' to win the Eastern Conference.
The Celtics trail the Pistons by 5.5 games and have excelled since Thanksgiving with a 29-11 record.
Boston boasts a higher offensive rating, while Detroit excels defensively; both teams are close in net rating.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The setlist included a mix of songs from Isbell's solo work, 400 Unit albums, and covers like 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking.'
Isbell highlighted themes of sobriety and personal experiences, accompanied by acoustic and electric arrangements during the concert.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are unlikely to secure top edge rushers like Maxx Crosby or Trey Hendrickson before the NFL Draft.
New England may be priced out of landing edge rushers Hendrickson, Jaelan Phillips, and Odafe Oweh in free agency.
With $40 million in cap space, the Patriots might target edge rusher prospects in the 2026 NFL Draft.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance aims to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS could integrate sports coverage, potentially expanding MLB and NHL broadcasts on CBS networks.
Netflix, opting out of bidding, focuses on live sports rights, possibly targeting CBS's NFL package in future deals.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots interested in A.J. Brown but deem the Eagles' current asking price of a first and second-round pick excessive.
Trading A.J. Brown before June 1 would cost Eagles $44 million in dead money, impacting their cap space.
Patriots exploring keeping Stefon Diggs alongside Brown, potentially needing Diggs to restructure his $26.5 million contract.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts is switching E-ZPass transponders to RFID sticker tags to save $7.4 million annually.
The new RFID sticker tags are free and eliminate the previous $20 replacement fee for transponders.
MassDOT projects monthly savings of $615,000 as sticker tags cost 55 cents compared to $6.70 for transponders.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito from Woburn has been indicted for evading over $1.2 million in taxes by underreporting $20 million in income.
Brito pleaded not guilty to 10 tax charges, including evasion and filing false returns, in Middlesex Superior Court.
Authorities found $35,000 in cash at his home and business, and Brito must surrender his passport and limit travel.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system; public health officials consider risk to public low.
Residents advised to avoid contact with wildlife; recent human cases in U.S. showed mild to moderate symptoms.
CDC warns those with close exposure to birds, like wildlife workers, are at higher risk; protective equipment recommended.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, projected 2026 NFL Draft top pick, expressed interest in mentorship from Tom Brady.
Mendoza, a Boston native, spoke with Brady and hopes to join the Brady-minority-owned Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza had a standout college season, winning the Heisman and leading Indiana to a national championship.
